channel.title: Paying $85 To Who Ever Can Help Me With My Lag Issues
channel.description: I'm sick of this - Every time I teleport (on a server I play) I dc. Every time I log in it takes over 15 mins to load. My computer is brand new - All I got on it is winrar, java, and globalpkz(server I play). I will pay $85 or give you my xbox 360 if you can help me fix this. My compuer is a compaq brand, which I have windows xp. ITS BRAND NEW, SO WHAT THE **** CAN POSSIBLY BE THE PROBLEM????

item.title: Paying $85 To Who Ever Can Help Me With My Lag Issues
item.dc:creator: @Shoplifter0 Shoplifter0
item.description:
@Shoplifter0 wrote:

[quote=“halolouis, post:11, topic:348385”][quote author=zerogordo link=topic=444764.msg3267106#msg3267106 date=1278948686]

Well the only quick instant remedy that comes to mind is changing the index cap for players
on the server. Depending on the way teleporting works that might fix that. It will probably fix
your log in problem as well.
for example

public static Player[] players = new Player[2000];

would work better with

public static Player[] players = new Player[100];

That is 508 I believe and that 2000 will show up in other files as well so just do a folder search for 2000 or whatever
your player cap is and change em to a lower number.
cheers

Fail.
[/quote]
Why don’t you STFU and post your own effing answer. It freaking works…
Every time a player logs in it must update all other players. The update package
is quite large and when it updates 1999 nulls WTF is the point…[/quote]I searched 2000, I found nothing.

Read full topic
item.source: Paying $85 To Who Ever Can Help Me With My Lag Issues

item.title: Paying $85 To Who Ever Can Help Me With My Lag Issues
item.dc:creator: @halolouis halolouis
item.description:
@halolouis wrote:

[quote=“zerogordo, post:10, topic:348385”][quote author=halolouis link=topic=444764.msg3266925#msg3266925 date=1278920667]
Well the only quick instant remedy that comes to mind is changing the index cap for players
on the server. Depending on the way teleporting works that might fix that. It will probably fix
your log in problem as well.
for example

public static Player[] players = new Player[2000];

would work better with

public static Player[] players = new Player[100];

That is 508 I believe and that 2000 will show up in other files as well so just do a folder search for 2000 or whatever
your player cap is and change em to a lower number.
cheers
[/quote]

Fail.[/quote]
Why don’t you STFU and post your own effing answer. It freaking works…
Every time a player logs in it must update all other players. The update package
is quite large and when it updates 1999 nulls WTF is the point…

item.title: Paying $85 To Who Ever Can Help Me With My Lag Issues
item.dc:creator: @lord_fear lord_fear
item.description:
@lord_fear wrote:

I’m geusing your running on a 512mb-1024mb(1gb) of ram with a 1.72ghz processor.
Windows xp home edition/pro/student
Is it only you playing it?
Do you have other people playing it?
Are you hosting it?

Read full topic
item.source: Paying $85 To Who Ever Can Help Me With My Lag Issues

item.title: Paying $85 To Who Ever Can Help Me With My Lag Issues
item.dc:creator: @mursanari mursanari
item.description:
@mursanari wrote:

towriss:

hm how much ram does it have?

if its brand new it doesnt matter how much ram its got, because it has no files on it and all new computers come with 1gb + ram. what you really want to look at is your proccesor or grapics processor.

and perhaps it your internet connection. if not maybe its a fualty server try another one and if it still lags then i cant help you :S

Read full topic
